p:
A transcriptional profiling confirmed that a delNS1 virus infection caused a much more potent induction of an immuno-stimulatory gene pattern compared with wild-type virus
71 . Correspondingly, infection of macrophages with the delNS1 virus is not only associated with an ICD, but also with a more potent stimulation of innate cytokines as compared with wild-type viruses
72 . The removal of C-terminal domains of NS1 provoked release of type I IFN, interleukin 6 (IL-6), tumor necrosis factor α (TNF-α), and chemokine (C–C motif) ligand 3 (CCL3)
72 . Removal of N-terminal domains induced release of interleukin 1β (IL-1β) and interleukin 18 (IL-18)
72 .
